unnormalised: So, someone asked me about taking a loan. I thought I'd share my experience. Last year, I needed some quick cash to expand my mithai shop during Diwali. It’s a small family business, and Diwali is HUGE. I was looking at getting a ₹5 lakh loan.
normalised: so, someone asked me about taking a loan. I thought I would share my experience. last year, I needed some quick cash to expand my mithai shop during diwali. it's a small family business, and diwali is huge. I was looking at getting a rupee five lakh loan.

unnormalised: First, I approached SBI. They offered me a rate of 9.5% p.a. which sounded okay, but the paperwork was a nightmare. Then my cousin suggested I check out HDFC Bank. They had a Diwali special loan with a processing fee of just Rs. 2500, which was lower than SBI. The rate was similar, around 9.25%.
normalised: first, I approached S-B-I. they offered me a rate of nine point five percent p.a. which sounded okay, but the paperwork was a nightmare. then my cousin suggested I check out H-D-F-C bank. they had a diwali special loan with a processing fee of just rupees two thousand five hundred, which was lower than S-B-I. the rate was similar, around nine point two five percent.

unnormalised: I ended up going with a smaller cooperative bank near my house, the "Janata Sahakari Bank". They offered me a loan of Rs 3 Lakh at 10% interest with minimal documentation. The best part? They knew my business, knew me, and didn't treat me like just another application number. I paid it back in 12 months.
normalised: I ended up going with a smaller cooperative bank near my house, the "janata sahakari bank". they offered me a loan of rupees three lakh at ten percent interest with minimal documentation. the best part? they knew my business, knew me, and didn't treat me like just another application number. I paid it back in twelve months.

unnormalised: Moral of the story? Don’t just go for the big names. Check out smaller banks and NBFCs too. And don't be afraid to negotiate! Ask around, compare rates and hidden charges (like pre-payment penalties). Do your homework before committing to any loan, whether it's for Rs. 1000 or 10,00,000. Good luck!
